description:
Van Tubergen, Treutler & Hayes (VTH Law) handles cases involving serious litigation ranging from civil law, criminal law, family law, personal injury law, probate/estate planning as well as Bankruptcy. Our team at Van Tubergen, Treutler & Hayes PLLC offers experienced, knowledgeable, comprehensive and compassionate representation. Whether you are facing bankruptcy, divorce, an injury, criminal charges or a real estate matter, we are the go-to law firm for people who need counsel and effective representation to resolve the issues and move forward. Our practice areas include personal injury, estate planning, elder law, family law, criminal law, general civil litigation, appeals, business/commercial transactions and landlord-tenant disputes.

Since our law firm was founded in 2003, we have been dedicated to providing a broad range of legal disciplines in any setting. Our attorneys appear on behalf of clients in state and federal courts, before administrative panels, and at the negotiation table. We have attorneys licensed in 5 different states in addition to federal courts and tribal courts. Through careful planning, we consistently steer people through the process and toward their goals. Our accomplishments include seven-figure awards in personal injury cases and not guilty verdicts in criminal defense cases.

We are a practice that offers the following:
  • A small-firm touch with big-firm resources
  • Customized strategies for success
  • Available and accessible attorneys
  • Honest feedback

Outside our office, we are highly involved in community organizations. Three of our attorneys are from the Grand Haven area, and we take pride in volunteering our time and talents to local groups, non-profits, school boards and events. Van Tubergen, Treutler & Hayes PLLC (VTH Law) takes cases in Grand Haven, Muskegon, Holland, Allendale, Grand Rapids and throughout Ottawa, Muskegon and Kent Counties. Our law firm offers free initial consultations and accepts credit cards.

VTH Law is a debt relief law firm. We help people file for bankruptcy relief under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code.
